Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment, Profile-based risk for women and returning Haitians
Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistencies in testimony, Country conditions for women and returning Haitians
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Negative credibility finding due to inconsistencies
Legal_Rule: Profile-based claims must be properly analyzed even if credibility is challenged
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on gender and returnee status
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to credibility and insufficient profile analysis
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to provide adequate reasoning on profile argument
Applicant_Challenge: Error in credibility and profile-based risk analysis
Court_Result: Remitted for re-determination by a different panel
Defendant_Response: Board defended its credibility and risk assessment
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, Documentary evidence on country conditions
Remedy_Requested: Allow judicial review and remit for new hearing
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA, Section 101(1)(a) of IRPA
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division process, Judicial review process
